description:
This course will examine obesity from scientific, cultural, psychological, and economic perspectives. The complex matrix of factors that contribute to obesity and established treatment options will be explored. 

This course satisfies the Society & Social Structures Sector for Nursing Class of 2012 and Beyond.
name: OBESITY AND SOCIETY

values.comments:
This course examines obesity from scientific, cultural, psychological, and
economic perspectives. The complex matrix of factors that contribute to obesity and
established treatment options are explored.
Students were overwhelmingly enthusiastic about this course. One student
described the course as an “eye-opener” and referred to the class as “one of the best” the
student has taken at Penn.
The students had entirely positive reviews of Professor Compher, as well as the
guest speakers, who were described as “fascinating.” The students explained that
Professor Compher brought a fresh perspective to a familiar subject.
Students did not consider this course too demanding. Students found the
assignments worthwhile and the assessments fair.
This course satisfies the Society & Social Structures Sector for Nursing Class of
2012 and Beyond.
This review was based on 7 responses.

This course examines obesity from scientific, cultural, psychological, and
economic perspectives. The complex matrix of factors that contribute to obesity and
established treatment options are explored.
Students were very happy with the class, calling it "amazing" and "an eye
opener." The course provided a good balance of lectures, group work, and written
assignments. Students loved the "no pressure" atmosphere, emphasis on discussion, and
"fun and interesting" assignments.
The course was co-taught by Professors Kral and Compher. Students benefited
from "excellent" speakers and the ABCS component, although several remarked that it
could have been designed better.
The course satisfies the Society & Social Structures Sector for Nursing Class of
2012 and beyond.
This review was based on 7 responses.
